title: Make command gives Error 101
body:
When running the make command within the Lighthouse folder (step 3 in the detailed instruction),
I get errors after it has succesfully  compiled a few repositories.

The error stack trace looks like this within the console:


`error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> /home/pi/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/leveldb-0.8.4/src/database/mod.rs:112:35
    |
112 | ...                   c_string.as_bytes_with_nul().as_ptr() as *const i8,
    |                       ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected u8, found i8
    |
    = note: expected type `*const u8`
               found type `*const i8`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
   --> /home/pi/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/leveldb-0.8.4/src/database/mod.rs:121:36
    |
121 |             Err(Error::new_from_i8(error))
    |                                    ^^^^^ expected i8, found u8
    |
    = note: expected type `*const i8`
               found type `*mut u8`

error[E0308]: mismatched types

              found type `extern "C" fn(*mut libc::c_void, *const i8, usize, *const i8, usize) -> i32 {<T as database::comparator::InternalComparator>::compare}`

               found type `extern "C" fn(*mut libc::c_void, *const i8, usize) {database::batch::deleted_callback::<K, T>}`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> /home/pi/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/leveldb-0.8.4/src/database/management.rs:17:28

17 | ...                   c_string.as_bytes_with_nul().as_ptr() as *const i8,

              found type `*const i8`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> /home/pi/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/leveldb-0.8.4/src/database/management.rs:24:32
   |
24 |         Err(Error::new_from_i8(error))
   |                                ^^^^^ expected i8, found u8

   = note: expected type `*const i8`
              found type `*mut u8`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> /home/pi/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/leveldb-0.8.4/src/database/management.rs:35:27
   |
35 |                           c_string.as_bytes_with_nul().as_ptr() as *const i8,
   |                           ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected u8, found i8
   |
   = note: expected type `*const u8`
              found type `*const i8`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
  --> /home/pi/.cargo/registry/src/github.com-1ecc6299db9ec823/leveldb-0.8.4/src/database/management.rs:42:32
   |
42 |         Err(Error::new_from_i8(error))
   |                                ^^^^^ expected i8, found u8
   |
   = note: expected type `*const i8`
              found type `*mut u8`

error: aborting due to 16 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `leveldb`.
warning: build failed, waiting for other jobs to finish...
error: failed to compile `lighthouse v0.1.0 (/home/pi/lighthouse/lighthouse)`, intermediate artifacts can be found at `/home/pi/lighthouse/target`

Caused by:
  build failed
make: *** [Makefile:9: install] Error 101
`

Hi @Moelbeck ! I believe this is because you're trying to run lighthouse on a 32bits machine, whilst we only support 64bits at the moment.
Let me know if that's not the case! :)
EDIT: On a side not, I think this issue is a duplicate of #756 ?

Sorry, did not see your message before now.

Im running a 64 bit Ubuntu, version 10.19.

Though, it is on a Raspberry PI 4 - not sure if that makes a difference?

Oh yep, I’ve had this before. Sorry, I’ve been on holidays and not watching
notifications.

I think this is related to ARM. I solved it by modifying the leveldb crate;
basically just following the guidance of the compile errors to make it
compile. Someone else had the same problem and solved it the same way.

If you’re familiar with Rust and keen to get it to work, you could do the
same. For the long term, it seems we should make our own ARM-friendly fork
of the leveldb crate. Perhaps we can use this issue to track that task.
-- 
Kind Regards,

Paul Hauner

+61488 788800
paul@paulhauner.com
www.paulhauner.com
